p: Improving access to multidisciplinary care was seen as the second most important issue. Given the complexity of PD, a multidisciplinary approach is likely needed to optimize the care of such patients. Indeed, such care models have been shown to improve quality of life in PD in randomized trials [ 61, 62]. As yet, several barriers to establishing multidisciplinary care in MENASA countries exist, such as lack of neurologists and ancillary health care providers trained in PD. Others include the paucity of centers providing the whole range of necessary services, and the need to re-organize them in the rare instances that they are available.
